In that sentence it was said that those who are made deities, the angels, jinns, prophets, saints, etc., do not themselves know when will be the Resurrection. questions.question: Which of the following is the greatest form of Jihad according to the Prophet(S.A.W.)?
questions.optionc: waging war in the course of A llah
questions.correction: The greatest form of Jihad according to the Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W.) is suppressing one's selfish desires. This is often referred to as the 'greater jihad', the struggle against the lower self (nafs). The 'lesser jihad' is the physical struggle against the enemies of Islam.

questions.question: A major lesson contained in Hadith 16 of an-Nawawi is
questions.correction: Hadith 16 of an-Nawawi is about controlling anger. The Hadith says: 'I asked the Messenger of Allah: Who is the best among the people? He replied, 'The one who, when you look at him, you remember Allah.' Then I asked: Then who? He replied, 'The one who does not harm the Muslims with his tongue and hands.' Then I asked: Then who? He replied, 'The one who controls his anger.'

questions.question: Makkah is referred to in the Quran chapter 95 verse 3 as the city of
questions.correction: In the Quran chapter 95 verse 3, Makkah is referred to as the city of security. The verse says 'And [by] this secure city [Makkah],' Therefore, the correct answer is 'security'.

questions.question: The Tahajjud is observed between
questions.correction: The Tahajjud prayer is observed between Isha (night prayer) and Fajr (dawn prayer). It is a voluntary prayer and is highly recommended in Islam.

questions.question: The following Suwar begin with divine command to the Prophet except Surah
questions.correction: Surah ad-Duha does not begin with a divine command to the Prophet. It begins with an oath by the morning light (Duha) and the night when it settles. The other Surahs listed (an-Nas, al-Falaq, al-Kafirun) all begin with a command or a statement to the Prophet.

questions.question: A Juz' of the Quran is subdivided into the following except
questions.correction: A Juz' of the Quran is subdivided into Hizb, Nisf, and Rub'. Manzil is not a subdivision of a Juz'. Instead, the Quran is divided into seven Manzil to allow for it to be read over a week.

questions.question: "La Taghdab" in Hadith 16 means
questions.correction: "La Taghdab" in Hadith 16 means "do not get angry". This is a part of a Hadith where a man asked the Prophet for advice and he replied, "Do not get angry".

questions.question: The Surah which beins with four oaths is
questions.correction: The Surah which begins with four oaths is Surah at-Tin (The Fig). The Surah starts with the verses "By the fig and the olive, And [by] Mount Sinai, And [by] this secure city [Makkah]," which are considered as oaths.

questions.question: Imam an-Nasal spent his days in
questions.correction: Imam an-Nasai, a notable Hadith scholar, spent his days in Khurasan. He was born in the city of Nasa in present-day Turkmenistan, and he spent most of his life studying and teaching Hadith in the region of Khurasan.

questions.question: Which of the following is an exclusive obligation of the husband?
questions.correction: In Islam, the provision of shelter is an exclusive obligation of the husband. This is part of the financial responsibilities of the husband towards his wife, which also includes providing food and clothing. Counselling, provision of job, and domestic support are not exclusive obligations of the husband.

questions.question: The last verse of Suratut-Tin describes Allah as the
questions.correction: The last verse of Suratut-Tin describes Allah as the 'Judge'. The verse is 'Is not Allah the most just of judges?' (Surah At-Tin, 95:8). Therefore, the correct answer is 'Judge'.

questions.question: Muslims should pay more attention to Hadith 5 of an-Nawawi because it
questions.correction: It discourages innovation in religion.

questions.question: The major teaching of Hadith 5 of an-Nawawi centres on
questions.correction: On the authority of Aishah, who said: The messenger of Allah said: p "He who innovates something in this matter of ours that is not of it will have it rejected." And in one version by Muslim it reads : "He who does an act which our matter is not in agreement with will have it rejected.

questions.question: To seek divine guidance, Muslims are encouraged to perform Salat
questions.correction: Salat Istikhara is a prayer for seeking divine guidance in decision-making. It is recommended when a Muslim is making a decision and seeks the guidance of Allah. Therefore, the correct answer is 'Istikhara'.

questions.question: Suratul Fatihah(Q.1:5) admonishes
questions.optionb: appreciate the mercy and grace of Allah
questions.optionc: give thanks and praises to Allah
questions.correction: Suratul Fatihah (Q.1:5) is the first chapter of the Quran and it emphasizes the worship of Allah alone. The verse says 'You alone we worship, and You alone we ask for help.' Therefore, the correct answer is 'Worship none except Almighty Allah'.

questions.question: A muslim is only permitted to marry his
questions.correction: According to Islamic law, a Muslim man is permitted to marry his late wife's sister. However, he is not permitted to marry his foster mother, his late father's wife, or his foster sister.

questions.question: The state into which the pilgrim enters befire the time of Hajj is
questions.correction: The state into which the pilgrim enters before the time of Hajj is called Ihram. Ihram is a sacred state which a Muslim must enter in order to perform the major pilgrimage (Hajj) or the minor pilgrimage (Umrah).

questions.question: Halimah, the wet nurse of Muhammad(S.A.W.) hailed from the Banu
questions.correction: Halimah, the wet nurse of Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W.), hailed from the Banu Sa'ad tribe. This tribe was known for its generosity and hospitality.

questions.question: The major teaching of Surah an-Nasr(Q. 110) is that
questions.optionc: man must strive to succeed in life
questions.correction: Surah an-Nasr (Q. 110) discusses the victory of Islam and the rapid expansion of the Muslim community. Therefore, the major teaching of this Surah is that Islam has a bright future.

questions.question: The Prophet lost his wife Khadijah in the year
questions.correction: The Prophet Muhammad lost his wife Khadijah in the year 619 C.E. This year is also known as the 'Year of Sorrow' in Islamic history due to the passing of both Khadijah and Muhammad's uncle, Abu Talib.

questions.question: The weakest of faith according to Hadith 34 of an-Nawawi is changig an evil with the
questions.correction: According to Hadith 34 of an-Nawawi, the weakest form of faith is changing an evil with the heart, which means hating it and feeling that it is wrong. This is considered the least that can be done when encountering evil.

questions.question: Sadaq is the exclusive property of the
questions.correction: Sadaq is the exclusive property of the 'Wife'. It is a mandatory gift from the husband to the wife in Islamic marriage.

questions.question: Any Hadith whose message is directly from Allah is
questions.correction: Any Hadith whose message is directly from Allah is 'Qudsi'. It is considered sacred and holds a higher status.

questions.question: Abu-Bakr was nicknamed as-Sadiq because of his
questions.correction: Abu-Bakr was nicknamed as-Sadiq because of his 'Truthfulness'. This nickname reflects his honesty and integrity.

questions.question: The verse which describes the essence of Allah is
questions.correction: The verse which describes the essence of Allah is 'Ayatul Kursiyy'. It is found in Surah Al-Baqarah 2:255.

questions.question: The first attempt for the collection of Hadith was made during the reign of
questions.correction: The first attempt for the collection of Hadith was made during the reign of 'Umar b. Abdul-'Aziz'. He is known for initiating the compilation of Hadith.

questions.question: Al-Quddus is to the Holy as Al-Mutakabbir is to the
questions.correction: Al-Quddus is to the Holy as Al-Mutakabbir is to the 'Supreme'. These attributes describe different aspects of Allah's nature.

questions.question: The Nisab is important because it is the basis of
questions.correction: The Nisab is important because it is the basis of 'Zakat'. It refers to the minimum amount of wealth a Muslim must have before they are obligated to pay Zakat.

questions.question: The Miraj is associated with Prophet
questions.correction: The Miraj is associated with Prophet 'Muhammad (S.A.W)'. It refers to the night journey and ascension to heaven.

questions.question: Who among the following is associated with the standardization of the Qur'an?
questions.correction: The person associated with the standardization of the Qur'an is 'Umar b. al-Khattab'. He played a significant role in its compilation and standardization.

questions.question: A decision taken in the interest of the public becomes
questions.correction: A decision taken in the interest of the public becomes 'Istislah'. It refers to public interest and welfare in Islamic jurisprudence.

questions.question: Belief in the Prophets of Allah implies that one should
questions.optiona: Follow some of them in the service of Allah
questions.optionb: Visit their tombs on annual pilgrimage
questions.optionc: Withdraw from society and live a solitary life.
questions.optiond: Emulate their examples in serving humanity
questions.correction: Belief in the Prophets of Allah implies that one should 'Emulate their examples in serving humanity'. This reflects the importance of following their teachings and conduct.

questions.question: An Hadith is referred to as da'if because
questions.optiona: It is sometimes supported with evidence
questions.optionc: It has defects in its isnad and matn
questions.correction: An Hadith is referred to as da'if because 'It has defects in its isnad and matn'. This means it lacks the necessary authenticity and reliability.

questions.question: Birabbil-Falaq in Qur'an 113 means
questions.optionc: From the envier when he envies
questions.correction: Birabbil-Falaq in Qur'an 113 means 'Lord of the daybreak'. It is a supplication for protection from the evil of darkness and envy.

questions.question: Which of the following is not among the articles of faith? Belief in the
questions.correction: Which of the following is not among the articles of faith? Belief in the 'Miracles'. The main articles of faith in Islam are belief in Allah, angels, prophets, scriptures, and the Day of Judgment.

questions.question: Lawhul-Mahfudh is associated with Quranic
questions.correction: Lawhul-Mahfudh is associated with Quranic 'Preservation'. It refers to the preserved tablet where Allah has recorded everything that will happen.

questions.question: The unity of Allah is expressed in Suratul-
questions.correction: The unity of Allah is expressed in Suratul-'Ikhlas'. This Surah emphasizes the oneness and uniqueness of Allah.

questions.question: The following are classifications of Hadith except
questions.correction: The following are classifications of Hadith except 'Mawdu'. The main classifications are Sahih, Hasan, and Da'if. Mawdu refers to fabricated Hadith.

questions.question: Khadijah married Muhammad (S.A.W) at the age of
questions.correction: Khadijah married Muhammad (S.A.W) at the age of '40'. This is well-documented in Islamic tradition.

questions.question: Which of the following prayers is not observed between Isha and Fajr?
questions.correction: Which of the following prayers is not observed between Isha and Fajr? 'Istisqa'. The other prayers include Tahajjud, Shaf'i, and Witr.

questions.question: Maliki yawmid-Din is translated as
questions.optionb: Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds
questions.optionc: The King of the Day of Judgement
questions.optiond: Guide us to the right path
questions.correction: Maliki yawmid-Din is translated as 'The King of the Day of Judgement'. It describes Allah's sovereignty on the Day of Judgment.

questions.question: The weakest of faith according to Hadith 34 of an-Nawawi is changing an evil with the
questions.correction: The weakest of faith according to Hadith 34 of an-Nawawi is changing an evil with the 'Heart'. This reflects the internal struggle and weakness of faith.

questions.question: Women are admonished to dress modestly by the Qur'an so that
questions.optionb: Responsible partners will come their way
questions.correction: Women are admonished to dress modestly by the Qur'an so that 'They will be respected outside'. Modesty in dress is meant to foster respect and avoid attracting undue attention.

questions.question: Out of 300,000 traditions collected by Imam Muslim, he selected
questions.correction: Out of 300,000 traditions collected by Imam Muslim, he selected '7,200'. These are considered authentic Hadiths included in his collection.

questions.question: Which of the following was not part of the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah?
questions.optiona: There should be no war for ten years
questions.optionb: Muhammad (SAW) should not enter Makkah that year
questions.optionc: If anybody wanted to join Muhammad (SAW), he should send him back.
questions.optiond: Muhammad (SAW) should not be recognized as leader
questions.correction: Which of the following was not part of the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah? 'Muhammad (SAW) should not be recognized as leader'. The treaty focused on the terms of peace and non-aggression, not on leadership recognition.

questions.question: The 8th of DHUl-Hijjah is Yawmut-Tarwiyyah because
questions.optiona: It marks the beginning of Hajj rites
questions.optionb: Pilgrims visit the Jamarat and make a sacrifice
questions.optionc: The first Tawaf is performed at the Ka'bah
questions.optiond: Pilgrims spend the night in supplication at Muzdalifah
questions.correction: The 8th of DHUl-Hijjah is Yawmut-Tarwiyyah because 'It marks the beginning of Hajj rites'. It is the day when pilgrims prepare for the main rites of Hajj.

questions.question: The blow of the trumphet at resurrection is the duty of angel
questions.correction: The blow of the trumpet at resurrection is the duty of angel 'Israfil'. He will blow the trumpet to announce the Day of Resurrection.

questions.question: A major teaching of the belief in the hereafter is that
questions.optiona: Muslims will enjoy the intercession of Prophet Muhammad(SAW)
questions.optionb: Possession of worldly things should be the ultimate goal in life
questions.optionc: Angel Azrail is responsible for taking of souls
questions.optiond: Associating partners with Allah is unpardonable
questions.correction: A major teaching of the belief in the hereafter is that 'Associating partners with Allah is unpardonable'. This reflects the importance of monotheism in Islam.

questions.question: Absolute obedience to the Prophet's teaching is stated in an-Nawawi's Hadith
questions.correction: Absolute obedience to the Prophet's teaching is stated in an-Nawawi's Hadith '41'. This Hadith emphasizes the importance of following the Prophet's guidance.

questions.question: Muhammad's (SAW) marriage with Khadijah was blessed with
questions.correction: Muhammad's (SAW) marriage with Khadijah was blessed with 'Six children'. They had four daughters and two sons.

questions.question: The number of verses contained in Suratul-Kafirun (Q. 109) is
questions.correction: The number of verses contained in Suratul-Kafirun (Q. 109) is '6'. This Surah addresses the disbelievers and their rejection of faith.

questions.question: The Hadith collection of Bukhari and Muslim are similar in the following ways except that they
questions.optiona: Both cover the whole range of fiqh
questions.optionb: Are the best for the tafsir of the Qur'an
questions.optiond: Have chapters on rewards and punishments
questions.correction: The Hadith collection of Bukhari and Muslim are similar in the following ways except that they 'Are the best for the tafsir of the Qur'an'. While they are comprehensive, they are not primarily focused on Qur'anic exegesis.

questions.question: Uthman b. Affan was born to the family of Banu
questions.correction: Uthman b. Affan was born to the family of Banu 'Umayyah'. This family was a prominent clan within the Quraysh tribe.

questions.question: The first revelation to the Prophet (SAW) is Qur'an chapter
questions.correction: The first revelation to the Prophet (SAW) is Qur'an chapter '96:1-5'. This chapter is known as Surah Al-'Alaq and marks the beginning of revelation.

questions.question: The following are authors of Sihahus-Sitta except
questions.correction: The following are authors of Sihahus-Sitta except 'Malik b. Anas'. The Sihahus-Sitta include works by Ibn Majah, Abu Dawud, and At-Tirmidhi, but Malik b. Anas is not among them.

questions.question: How many times does the word A'bud and its derivatives occur in Suratul-Kafirun
questions.correction: How many times does the word A'bud and its derivatives occur in Suratul-Kafirun? 'Three'. This reflects the emphasis on monotheism and worship in this Surah.

questions.question: Abu Sufyan accepted Islam because he was
questions.optiona: Interested in the leadership of the Muslims
questions.correction: Abu Sufyan accepted Islam because he was 'Surprised by the Prophet's magnanimity'. His conversion was influenced by the Prophet's generosity and the new direction of the Muslim community.

questions.question: Excellent or sound traditions are grouped under
questions.correction: Excellent or sound traditions are grouped under 'Sahih'. These are considered the most authentic Hadiths.

questions.question: Truth has come and falsehood has vanished was uttered by the Prophet (SAW) when
questions.optionc: He got to the city of Yathrib
questions.correction: 'Truth has come and falsehood has vanished' was uttered by the Prophet (SAW) when 'Umar embraced Islam'. This was a significant moment in the early days of Islam.

questions.question: Khalaqal insana min alaq (Q. 96:2) is followed by
questions.correction: Khalaqal insana min alaq (Q. 96:2) is followed by 'Iqra warabbukal Akram'. This verse continues the theme of divine creation and the importance of learning.

questions.question: Who among the following is not a narrator of Hadith?
questions.correction: Who among the following is not a narrator of Hadith? 'Khadijah bint Khuwaylid'. Abu Hurayrah, Aisha bint Abi-Bakr, and Abu Sa'ad b. Malik were all known narrators of Hadith.
